publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4429 Pauline McNeill: Action on Ticket Touting—That the Parliament supports the campaign initiated by DF Concerts to prohibit the unauthorised resale of tickets for concerts and events; notes that ticket touting is extremely prevalent and that many unofficial outlets are guilty of huge mark-ups on a ticket’s face value, for example at events like T in the Park or major UK tours; condemns the exploitation of concert goers and music fans; notes that there is a particular effect upon young people who are often more likely to be persuaded into paying prices which they may not be able to afford; further notes the disgraceful actions of Get Me Tickets Ltd whose recent sale of non-existent tickets resulted in 200 young people being stranded outside a venue; supports the work of the Secretaries of State for Culture, Media and Sport and for Trade and Industry who aim to protect the public from this exploitation, and calls on the Scottish Executive to investigate how it can better support legitimate events promoters and work with the UK Government to protect Scotland’s events and concert goers.
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-4429 Pauline McNeill: Action on Ticket Touting—That the Parliament supports the campaign initiated by DF Concerts to prohibit the unauthorised resale of tickets for concerts and events; notes that ticket touting is extremely prevalent and that many unofficial outlets are guilty of huge mark-ups on a ticket’s face value, for example at events like T in the Park or major UK tours; condemns the exploitation of concert goers and music fans; notes that there is a particular effect upon young people who are often more likely to be persuaded into paying prices which they may not be able to afford; further notes the disgraceful actions of Get Me Tickets Ltd whose recent sale of non-existent tickets resulted in 200 young people being stranded outside a venue; supports the work of the Secretaries of State for Culture, Media and Sport and for Trade and Industry who aim to protect the public from this exploitation, and calls on the Scottish Executive to investigate how it can better support legitimate events promoters and work with the UK Government to protect Scotland’s events and concert goers. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Linda Fabiani*, Jackie Baillie*, Brian Adam*, Frances Curran*, Nora Radcliffe*, Rob Gibson*, Karen Gillon*, Trish Godman*, Robin Harper*, Eleanor Scott*, Margaret Jamieson*
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Chris Ballance*, Bristow Muldoon*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Mr Frank McAveety*
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Bruce Crawford*
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-4429 Action on Ticket Touting (lodged on 22 May 2006) Cathy Peattie*
